messages: 6c485faf792dbf2f15b681b53dcf7516 (13:00): which variable stores the number of rows updated,when rows r updated

3f80d62ed949f29a551f0f7d97ab8089 (13:34): sql%rowcount - is usable in pl/sql block
6c485faf792dbf2f15b681b53dcf7516 (13:35): what about that u said?
3f80d62ed949f29a551f0f7d97ab8089 (13:35): if you do something begin update x set y=z; if sql%rowcount =0...
27fa0f96dfc03bb1f2bebd6fee16f716 (13:35): hmm so i have an application using oci8 for connection
27fa0f96dfc03bb1f2bebd6fee16f716 (13:36): for some reason since the client has changed *something* the app is now unable to connect for a while
27fa0f96dfc03bb1f2bebd6fee16f716 (13:36): unfortunately they cannot talk to the dba's to debug this
27fa0f96dfc03bb1f2bebd6fee16f716 (13:36): how could i debug the situation from the client machine?
27fa0f96dfc03bb1f2bebd6fee16f716 (13:43): i guess tnsping could help a bit
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (13:55): lsmith: that problem could be anything from oracle library fucks to a dodgy ethernet cable
27fa0f96dfc03bb1f2bebd6fee16f716 (13:59): hali: yeah i know
27fa0f96dfc03bb1f2bebd6fee16f716 (14:03): its a suicide mission
27fa0f96dfc03bb1f2bebd6fee16f716 (14:04): i know that they had some emergency updates, they also updated their firewalls
27fa0f96dfc03bb1f2bebd6fee16f716 (14:04): *sigh*
27fa0f96dfc03bb1f2bebd6fee16f716 (14:04): well i am telling them to check via tnsping
27fa0f96dfc03bb1f2bebd6fee16f716 (14:04): that way i hope to atleast proof its not the fault of php
3f80d62ed949f29a551f0f7d97ab8089 (14:04): you can trace oracle client
3f80d62ed949f29a551f0f7d97ab8089 (14:05): something like "statement tracer for Oracle"
3f80d62ed949f29a551f0f7d97ab8089 (14:05): it is client-side tracer
27fa0f96dfc03bb1f2bebd6fee16f716 (14:05): ah ok
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (14:08): and up the listener trace level as well perhaps
27fa0f96dfc03bb1f2bebd6fee16f716 (14:08): hell: that apps seems to work on statements .. i do not even get that far

27fa0f96dfc03bb1f2bebd6fee16f716 (14:10): hali: no i have not .. i remember back in the day there was msie for solaris
27fa0f96dfc03bb1f2bebd6fee16f716 (14:10): and i heard people got msie to work via wine

443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (14:11): very clean
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (14:11): http://www.tatanka.com.br/ies4linux/page/Main_Page

27fa0f96dfc03bb1f2bebd6fee16f716 (14:11): ah .. it is the wine based stuff

443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (14:11): quite impressive little script
27fa0f96dfc03bb1f2bebd6fee16f716 (14:11): indeed
